translated: Great Heap of Jewels Sutra, Scroll 30
Translated by the Trepiá¹­aka Master Bodhiruci of the Great Tang Dynasty, under Imperial Edict
Thus have I heard:
Once, the Buddha was at Gá¹›dhrakÅ«á¹­a Mountain in RÄjagá¹›ha, together with a great assembly of five hundred bhiká¹£us, all of whom had attained great mastery;
There were also eighty koá¹­Ä«s of nayutas of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, all of whom were in their last lifetime, with Maitreya Bodhisattva at the head;
There were also forty koá¹­Ä«s of nayutas of great bodhisattvas, with MaÃ±juÅ›rÄ«, Prince of the Dharma, at the head.

At that time, there was a youth in the assembly named Candraprabha, who immediately rose from his seat, bared his right shoulder, touched his right knee to the ground, bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, joined his palms in respect, and said to the Buddha:
World-Honored One!
What kind of karma did the TathÄgata cultivate in the past, that he was able to attain such a definitive light, and to gather and take up
light, light of arousal, light of manifestation, light of various colors,
light of unmixed colors, light of narrowness, light of vastness, light of purity,
light of universal purity, light of impurity, light of extreme impurity, light of
separation from impurity, light of gradual increase, light of freshness, light of extreme freshness,
light of boundlessness, light of extreme boundlessness, light of immeasurability, light of extreme immeasurability,
light of innumerability, light of extreme innumerability, light of swiftness, light of extreme swiftness, light of non-abiding, light of non-dwelling, light of blazing,
light of illumination, light of delight, light of reaching the other shore, light of
unobstructedness, light of immovability, light of uprightness, light of dwelling in the boundless realm, light of form,
Light of characteristics, light of various forms, light of immeasurable forms, light of blue, yellow,
red, and white forms, light of red forms, light of crystal-colored forms,
light of space-colored forms - such various lights, each one also combines with the five
colored lights to manifest, up to blue, yellow, red, white, and so forth, each one also
combines with immeasurable and boundless various colored lights to manifest?
At that time the World-Honored One spoke a verse for Moonlight, saying:
I, through the causes and conditions of inconceivable good karma,
Far removed from all delusions, accomplish various lights.
Again, with various practices, I abide in the Buddha's path,
Using the wisdom of emptiness and non-action, I manifest the combined light.
It is like the various different forms in the external dharmas,
In the midst of this, there is emptiness and no self, no creator, and no mind.
Moreover, just as in the inner body, there is emptiness, no self, and no creator,
In the midst of this, one is able to manifest various sounds.
Due to this non-creation, boundless colored lights are manifested,
In accordance with their wishes, all are caused to attain fulfillment.
Or in a single light, two kinds of colors are produced,
Each having superior, middling, and inferior distinctions, which manifest separately.
Or in a single light, three kinds of colors are produced,
Each having superior, middling, and inferior distinctions, which manifest separately.
Or in a single light, four kinds of colors are produced,
Each having superior, middling, and inferior distinctions, which manifest separately.
Or in a single light, five kinds of colors are produced,
Each having superior, middling, and inferior distinctions, born from pure karma.
Or within a single light, six kinds of colors are produced,
Each with upper, middle, and lower, born from skillful means.
Or within a single light, seven kinds of colors are produced,
Each with upper, middle, and lower, born from good karma.
Or within a single light, eight kinds of colors are produced,
Each with upper, middle, and lower, born from superior goodness.
Or within a single light, nine kinds of colors are produced,
Each with upper, middle, and lower, born from provisions.
Or within a single light, ten kinds of colors are produced,
Each with upper, middle, and lower, born from giving.
Or within a single thing, twenty colors are produced,
Each with upper, middle, and lower, born from upholding precepts.
Or within a single thing, thirty colors are produced,
Each has upper, middle, and lower, born from patience.
In one thing, forty colors are produced,
Each has upper, middle, and lower, born from diligence.
In one thing, fifty colors are produced,
Each has upper, middle, and lower, born from meditation.
In one thing, sixty colors are produced,
Each has upper, middle, and lower, born from wisdom.
In one thing, seventy colors are produced,
Each has upper, middle, and lower, born from a compassionate mind.
In one thing, eighty colors are produced,
Each has upper, middle, and lower, born from a compassionate mind.
In one thing, ninety colors are produced,
Each has upper, middle, and lower, born from a joyful mind.
Or within a single phenomenon, a hundred kinds of colors are produced,
Each with upper, middle, and lower, arising from the mind of equanimity.
Or within a single phenomenon, a thousand kinds of colors are produced,
Each with upper, middle, and lower, arising from a thousand merits.
Or within a single phenomenon, ten thousand kinds of colors are produced,
Each with upper, middle, and lower, arising from the provisions of merit.
Or within a single phenomenon, a koá¹­i of colors are manifested,
Each with upper, middle, and lower, arising from pure faith.
Or within a single phenomenon, two koá¹­is of colors are manifested,
Each with upper, middle, and lower, arising from sympathetic joy.
Or within a single phenomenon, three koá¹­is of colors are manifested,
Each with upper, middle, and lower, arising from lightness and comfort.
Or within a single phenomenon, four koá¹­is of colors are manifested,
Each has upper, middle, and lower, born from respecting the Buddha.
In one thing, five koá¹­is of colors are manifested,
Each has upper, middle, and lower, born from respecting the Dharma.
In one thing, six koá¹­is of colors are manifested,
Each has upper, middle, and lower, born from respecting the Saá¹…gha.
In one thing, seven koá¹­is of colors are manifested,
Each has upper, middle, and lower, born from respecting the precepts.
In one thing, eight koá¹­is of colors are manifested,
Each has upper, middle, and lower, born from respecting meditation.
In one thing, nine koá¹­is of colors are manifested,
Each has upper, middle, and lower, born from universal compassion.
In one thing, ten koá¹­is of colors are manifested,
Each has upper, middle, and lower, born from being heedful.
Moreover, from each pore, various lights are manifested,
Those lights have various names, which I will now explain for you.
I have a light called Cloud-Pure Illumination,
That light arises from the accumulation of immeasurable wholesome roots.
Because in the past, I saw sentient beings
With various illnesses and afflictions, all giving rise to a compassionate mind,
Providing them with medicine and healing them,
By these causes and conditions, I attained such light.
I also have a light called Eye-Purity,
By offering lamps and lights to the Buddha, it arises from this.
I also have a light called Ear-Purity,
By making offerings with sounds, it arises from this.
I also have a light called Nose-Purity,
By offering fragrant water, this is why I was born.
I also have a light called Pure Tongue,
By offering the best flavors, this is why I was born.
I also have a light called Pure Body,
By offering clothing, this is why I was born.
I also have a light called Pure Mind,
Always having faith and joy in the Buddha, this is why I was born.
I also have a light called Pure Form,
Painting Buddha images, this is why I was born.
I also have a light called Pure Sound,
Always praising the Dharma, this is why I was born.
I also have a light called Pure Fragrance,
Always respectfully serving the Saá¹…gha, this is why I was born.
I also have a light called 'Purity of Taste,'
By giving whatever is desired, it is born from this.
I also have a light called 'Purity of Touch,'
By offering scented ointments, it is born from this.
I also have a light called 'Purity of Dharma,'
By embracing all dharmas, it is born from this.
I also have a light called 'Purity of Earth,'
By sweeping and cleaning the ground for the Buddha and Sangha, it is born from this.
I also have a light called 'Purity of Water,'
By offering wells and springs, it is born from this.
I also have a light called 'Purity of Fire,'
By holding and offering fire, it is born from this.
I also have a light called 'Purity of Wind,'
Holding a fan and making offerings, thus I was born here.
I also have a light called Pure Aggregates,
Making offerings with my body to the Buddha, thus I was born here.
I also have a light called Pure Realms,
Always cultivating loving-kindness, thus I was born here.
I also have a light called Pure Truths,
Always avoiding false speech, thus I was born here.
I also have a light called Pure Lands,
Always practicing generosity, thus I was born here.
I also have a light called Pure Sounds,
Praising the buddhas, thus I was born here.
I also have a light called Pure Mindfulness,
Praising samÄdhi, thus I was born here.
I also have a light called Pure Eloquence,
Which arises from praising and praising the dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s.
I also have a light called Sun Conjunction,
Which arises from reconciling disputes.
I also have a light called Revealing Meaning,
Which arises from penetrating the nature of emptiness.
I also have a light called Blue Color Appearance,
Which arises from offering blue lotuses.
I also have a light called Yellow Color Appearance,
Which arises from offering karavÄ«ra flowers.
I also have a light called Red Color Appearance,
Which arises from offering pearls.
I also have a light called White Color Appearance,
By offering golden flowers, I was thus reborn.
I also have a light called Supreme Meritorious Virtue,
Adorned with various colors, I was thus reborn.
I also have a light called Dragon Power,
By offering dragon banners, I was thus reborn.
I also have a light called Elephant Power,
By offering elephant banners, I was thus reborn.
I also have a light called Lion King,
By offering lion banners, I was thus reborn.
I also have a light called King of Bulls,
By offering bull banners, I was thus reborn.
I also have a light called Moon Purity,
By sweeping and cleaning the Buddha's stupa, I was thus reborn.
I also have a light called Taming the Dragons,
By offering silk and belts, this is why I was born.
I also have a light called Taming the Yakshas,
By being able to contemplate the truth, this is why I was born.
I also have a light called Enlightening Women,
By being free from the characteristics of a woman, this is why I was born.
I also have a light called Enlightening Men,
By being free from the characteristics of a man, this is why I was born.
I also have a light called Vajra Power,
By the purity of karmic wisdom, this is why I was born.
I also have a light called Manifestation of Emptiness,
By revealing the worldly retribution, this is why I was born.
I also have a light called Enlightening the Truth,
Because of being free from inverted views, thus one is able to be born.
I also have a light called Revealing the Buddha's Words,
Praising the Dharma realm, thus one is able to be born.
I also have a light called Free from All Faults,
Praising the superior understanding, thus one is able to be born.
I also have a light called Adorning Universal Illumination,
Praising the offering of lamps, thus one is able to be born.
I also have a light called Free from Affection and Love,
Praising concentration and wisdom, thus one is able to be born.
I also have a light called Free from All Habits,
Praising the wisdom of the past, thus one is able to be born.
I also have a light called Free from All Attachments,
Praising the wisdom of non-arising, thus one is able to be born.
I also have a light called Leaving All Destinies,
Praising the wisdom of exhausting defilements, thus it is born.
I also have a light called Abandoning Locations,
Praising the wisdom of suffering, thus it is born.
I also have a light called Buddha's Spiritual Powers,
Praising spiritual powers, thus it is born.
I also have a light called Surpassing Playwords,
Praising omniscience, thus it is born.
I also have a light called Manifesting Various Colors,
Praising spiritual powers, thus it is born.
I also have a light called Delighting in Good Friends,
Praising the nature of enlightenment, thus it is born.
I also have a light called The Foremost of Eyes,
By praising the limit of the eye's present state, this is why I was born.
I also have a light called the limit of the eye's exhaustion,
By praising the inexhaustible, this is why I was born.
I also have a light called the limit of existence,
By praising non-existence, this is why I was born.
I also have a light called the indestructible,
By praising the nature of cessation, this is why I was born.
I also have a light called the boundless limit,
By praising the limitless, this is why I was born.
I also have a light called the characterized,
By praising the unconditioned, this is why I was born.
I also have a light called the unchanging,
By praising the undifferentiated, this is why I was born.
I also have a light called non-entry,
Praising non-attachment, therefore I was born from this.
I also have a light called non-emergence,
Praising non-arising, therefore I was born from this.
I also have a light called non-arising,
Praising non-appearance, therefore I was born from this.
I have a light called 'without representation,' which can mature all beings.
I have a light called 'the fundamental nature of dharmas,' which can shake koá¹­is of lands.
I have a light called 'taming MÄra,' which has the majestic virtue of frightening MÄra.
I have a light called 'merit banner,' holding its name one leaves behind danger and misfortune.
I have a light called 'powerful banner,' holding its name one leaves behind enmity.
I have a light called Tranquil Banner, those who uphold its name will be free from greed.
I have a light called Dhyana Banner, those who uphold its name will be free from wrong conduct.
I have a light called Fame Banner, those who uphold its name will attain praise.
I have a light called Delightful Banner, those who uphold its name will be free from sorrow and distress.
I have a light called Pure Precepts Banner, those who uphold its name will be free from violating precepts.
I have a light called Wonderful Fragrance Banner, those who uphold its name will be free from foul odors.

I have a light called The Profundity of the Dharma, those who uphold its name will be free from doubt and confusion.ğŸ”½I have a light called No Abiding, those who uphold its name will be free from all existences.
I have a light called Free from Discrimination, those who uphold its name will be free from grasping and attachment.
I have a light called Wonderful High Mountain, those who uphold its name will be unshakable.
I have a light named Secret Practice, those who uphold its name will be unattached.
I have a light named Liberation Practice, those who uphold its name will be unfettered.
I have a light named Well-Tamed, those who uphold its name will attain gentleness.
I have a light named Unwavering, those who uphold its name will be free from craving and defilements.ğŸ”½I have a light named Well-Subdued, those who uphold its name will have perfect precepts.

I have a light named Many Good Practices, those who uphold its name will be unstained.ğŸ”½I have a light named Much Benefit, those who hear its name will be free from faults.ğŸ”½I have a light named Excellent Knowledge and Vision, those who hear its name will be free from confusion.
I have a light named Seeking Benefit, those who hear its name will be free from anger.
I have a light named Mind Delightful, those who hear its name will attain peace and joy.
I have a light called No Heat or Distress; those who uphold its name will understand emptiness.

I have a light called Empty Nature; those who uphold its name will transcend frivolous arguments.ğŸ”½I have a light called No Support; those who uphold its name will be unshakable.ğŸ”½I have a light called Free from Delusion; those who uphold its name will not hesitate.
I have a light called No Abiding; those who uphold its name will be free from ignorance.

I have a light called Disdaining the Fleshly Body; those who uphold its name will not receive it again.ğŸ”½I have a light called No Grasping; those who uphold its name will be free from written words.
I have a light called No Delusion; those who uphold its name will be free from speech.ğŸ”½I have a light called No Going; those who uphold its name will know the future.
I have a light called Universal Limit; those who uphold its name will know the past.
I have a light named Unequaled, those who uphold its name will understand the absence of outflows.

I have a light named Attaining Sagehood, those who uphold its name will know the supreme.ğŸ”½I have a light named Unstained by Defilements, those who uphold its name will be free from all attachments.ğŸ”½I have a light named Free from Dust and Dirt, those who uphold its name will be without darkness and obstruction.
I have a light named Detachment, those who uphold its name will be free from reliance.
I have a light named Supreme, those who uphold its name will crush other teachings.
I have a light named Youthful, those who uphold its name will accomplish the six practices.
I have a light named Most Venerable, those who uphold its name will have unobstructed wisdom.
I have a light named Swift, those who uphold its name will accomplish the supreme Sangha.
I have a light named Having Characteristics, those who uphold its name will understand the profound Dharma.
I have a light called 'signless,' those who uphold its name will be free from arrogance.
I have a light called 'unborn,' those who uphold its name will attain non-acquisition.
I have a light called 'mindfulness of the Buddha,' praised by all TathÄgatas,
Cultivating practices in the presence of many Buddhas, one then attains such a light.
The lights manifested by the Buddha's body, as numerous as the dust motes in a trillion lands,
Such immeasurable trillion lands, their number like the sands of the great ocean,
In each dust mote, the lights each have many retinues,
The light universally goes to the buddha-lands without buddhas, transforming into the pure body of the TathÄgata,
Expounding the profound and subtle true Dharma, peacefully abiding sentient beings in patience.
I have a light called 'Buddha,' causing sentient beings to abide in the Buddha's path.
I have a light called Dharma, pure and illuminating, without blemish or defilement.
I have a light called Sangha, praised by all Buddhas and Tathagatas.
I have a light called purity, its radiance supreme, extremely difficult to attain.
I have a light called flower, benefiting sentient beings and enabling them to mature.
I have a light called Brahma, or called Indra, or called god,
called moon, called dragon, called yaksha, called asura, called garuda,
or called king, or called woman, or called maiden, or called boy,
such various lights, each using the good Dharma to transform those of the same kind,
able to cause countless koá¹­is of beings to all attain accomplishment in bodhi,
I have a light called wisdom, or called precepts, or called kindness,
Or called incense paste or music,
Such kinds of light each have their own names according to their original functions,
All of them gather countless kinds of living beings, and thus accomplish this light.
I have a light called respect, praised by the buddhas and tathÄgatas,
Always respectfully following the Buddha's teachings and Dharma, thus accomplishing this light.
The number of sentient beings seen by the Buddha's eye, the various lights manifested in a single pore,ğŸ”½And each of those lights
Each has its own retinue surrounding it,
In accordance with the thoughts in the minds of sentient beings, all are matured by the Buddha's light.
If there are those who hear the explanation of this light, able to give rise to joy and deep love and delight,
This person in the past, in the presence of the buddhas, has already heard such sÅ«tras.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
I have a light called Supreme, with a retinue of 80 koá¹­Ä«s,

I have a light called Sorrowless, with a retinue of 80 nayutas,
Upholding a single teaching of the TathÄgata, therefore I accomplished this light.
I have a light called Pure and Excellent, with a retinue of 80 koá¹­Ä«s,
If one is able to uphold a single samÄdhi, therefore I accomplished this light.
In the past there was a Buddha named Supreme, that Buddha abided in the world,
with a lifespan of immeasurable length.
When he first attained enlightenment, in the Dharma assembly there were then 80 nayutas of beings.
At that time, in this JambudvÄ«pa, there was a king named Sound of Joy.
The king also had five hundred princes, with upright and handsome features,
who were delighted upon seeing [the Buddha].
At that time, the father king had majestic virtue and freedom, and deeply gave rise to faith and joy in the Three Jewels.
All the excellent and wonderful gardens and parks that the king possessed, he offered to that World-Honored Buddha.
In the places for walking meditation in the gardens and parks, there were also countlessğŸ”½karnikara trees, karnikara trees, palasha trees,
udumbara trees, nyagrodha trees, and sala trees,

There were bhiká¹£us, with bodies the color of true gold, each sittingğŸ”½under the trees in this forest,

of exquisite jeweled canopies,

Atimukta, MahÄmÄndÄrava, and udumbara flowers,
blue lotus flowers, and so forth. Such various innumerable flower canopies,
Each of them is called according to its jeweled net.
Moreover, with golden threads and kuá¹­hÄma cloth, they are made into silk canopies, covering above.

The beds are further adorned with eighty koá¹­Ä«s of silk brocades and cushions.
All the kinds of sentient beings, up to the peak of existence, all come to assemble,
in the TathÄgata's place, listening to this sÅ«tra. The devas, nÄgas, yaká¹£as,
gandharva kings, mahoragas, and asuras,

The devas, nÄgas, yaká¹£as, and asuras, with sincere and pure minds,
Rained down mandÄra flowers, pearls, and other precious treasures, making offerings.
At that time, there were also 80 koá¹­Ä«s of powerful devas,
Who, having heard this sÅ«tra, gave rise to joyful minds and made bodhisattva vows,
In the future, they would attain this radiance.
At that time, the TathÄgata, knowing their aspirations, immediately gave them predictions, saying they would attain buddhahood.
At that time, there were also 80 koá¹­Ä«s of Åšakras, lords of the devas,
And the BrahmÄ assemblies, who, having heard this kind of sÅ«tra expounding the present radiance,
Also gave rise to joy, gave rise to the bodhi mind, and all received predictions,

Nayutas of dragons, having heard this sutra, gave rise to the mind of enlightenment,

At that time, King Leisheng made various offerings to that TathÄgata.
Could he be anyone else?
It is you yourself.
You have heard this sutra in the past, and for that reason, you are now asking about it again.
If there are people who, after my parinirvÄá¹‡a, when the Dharma wheel is about to be destroyed, give rise to pure faith in this teaching,
they will be able to widely expound this kind of sutra.
If one speaks this sutra in the future, then one will protect and uphold my Dharma,
like a good guide for a group of merchants, and is also called protecting and upholding the treasure store.
If one hears this sutra in the latter age and gives rise to joy for the duration of a finger snap,
one should know that it is all due to the Buddha's majestic spiritual power, and also because of MaÃ±juÅ›rÄ«'s empowerment and protection.
Such a person will be considered to have seen the buddhas and will be given the secret Dharma to become wise and intelligent.
If a person has a sincere and gentle mind and always diligently makes offerings to the buddhas,
Cultivating non-self and giving rise to the patience of compassion, this person delights in this sÅ«tra.
If a person always harbors an unwholesome mind, greedily seeking offerings without being content,
and has no yearning for tranquility, this person does not delight in this sÅ«tra.
If a person makes offerings to the TathÄgatas and is able to understand the profound and wondrous Dharma,
and gives rise to pure faith in the Buddha's right wisdom, this person delights in this sÅ«tra.
If a person is distracted and has no pure mind, always acting as an executioner and being difficult to tame,
and becoming a servant to the objects of desire, this person does not delight in this sÅ«tra.
If a person always delights in the araá¹‡ya, dwelling alone in solitude with a tranquil mind,
and is not attached to offerings or relatives, this person delights in this sÅ«tra.
If a person follows evil friends and destroys the wholesome dharmas of self and others,
They will often regress in precepts and concentration, and will not delight in this sÅ«tra.
If a person's mind is extremely pure, and they always contemplate phenomena with wisdom,
And are protected by good and wise friends, that person will delight in this sÅ«tra.
If a person is attached to their relatives and friends, and gives them flowers and fruits to please them,
With a mind lacking sincerity and harboring flattery, that person will not delight in this sÅ«tra.
If a person always thinks of the Buddhas' kindness, and delights in the supreme roots of goodness,
And dedicates [the merit] to enlightenment without flattery, that person will delight in this sÅ«tra.
If a person is attached to women, and adorns them with various fine garments,
And always wishes to play with them, that person will not delight in this sÅ«tra.
If a person's mind is deeply without support, and they are never defiled by objects of desire,
Not using food and drink to give rise to flattery, this person delights in this sÅ«tra.
If a person teaches and guides sentient beings, saying that desire has no faults,
Then they slander the Buddhas of the three times, this person does not delight in this sÅ«tra.
If a person's faith and delight are always firm, and they arouse diligence to seek the Dharma,
Not giving rise to fatigue or contempt, this person delights in this sÅ«tra.
If a person is attached to women, always harboring thoughts of desire,
Not cultivating wisdom and benefiting widely, this person does not delight in this sÅ«tra.
If a person sits in meditation in the mountains and forests, cultivating wisdom and purity,
Not greedy for any provisions, this person delights in this sÅ«tra.
If a person is always deluded about the past and future of the eyes and cannot understand,
They are foolish and bound by the snares of MÄra, and do not delight in this sÅ«tra.
If a person always penetrates the past and future of the eye without confusion,
They are liberated from the snares of MÄra, and delight in this sÅ«tra.
If a person is always confused and unable to understand the boundlessness of the eye,
They are foolish and bound by the snares of MÄra, and do not delight in this sÅ«tra.
If a person always penetrates the boundlessness of the eye without confusion,
They are liberated from the snares of MÄra, and delight in this sÅ«tra.
If a person is always confused and unable to understand the characteristics of the formation and disintegration of the eye,
They are foolish and bound by the snares of MÄra, and do not delight in this sÅ«tra.
If a person always penetrates the characteristics of the formation and disintegration of the eye without confusion,
